description.narrative: By end 2020, rule of law, separation of powers and constitutional democracy are entrenched in Uganda and all individuals are treated equally under the law and have equitable access to justice.

activity-description.narrative: The Rule of Law and Constitutional Democracy is designed to benefit the entire country as it is mainly on focuses on policy frameworks and laws. It also focuses on civic engagement with specific activities in Northern and Eastern Regions of the Country.

The Rule of Law and Constitutional Democracy is designed to benefit the entire country as it is mainly on focuses on policy frameworks and laws. It also focuses on civic engagement with specific activities in Northern and Eastern Regions of the Country.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1: 1.1.1.1: Percentage of Bills completed 1.1.1.2: % of enacted laws that are implemented 1.1.1.3: % Proportion of completed to registered cases 1.1.1.4 No. of bills that are human rights compliant enacted 1.1.1.5: Extent to which Electoral Commission effectively meet minimum core function performance benchmarks (Electoral laws implemented Credible register Level Playing field Transparency Voter education Free and credible elections Independence of EC) 1.1.1.6: Leadership forum in place and functional (Parliament, Elders forum)
Output 2: 1.1.2.1: No. of targeted democracy institutions with functional e-governance systems to promote efficiency and accountability a) No of courts connected to the Court Case Administration System (CCAS) b) Human Rights Information System (HURIS) c) Electoral Complaints Management System (ECMS) 1.1.2.2: No of districts in Northern and Eastern Uganda with a complete chain of frontline JLOS services (Police Station, Prosecution/legal aid, adjudication and Prison) 1.1.2.3: Extent to which HRC and Electoral Commission effectively meet minimum core function performance benchmarks 1.1.2.4: Proportion of HR cases disposed of
Output 3: 1.1.3.1: An inclusive and functional Civil Society’s engagement platform in place (MoU amongst CSOs ,Number of meetings, Reports) 1.1.3.2: Number of Journalists reporting on Human Rights promotion and good governance 1.1.3.3: Number of persons equipped with knowledge and advocacy skills on accountability for gender laws and policies disaggregated by sex, MPs and CSOs
Output 4: 1.1.4.1: Number of LCI, II and III court officials trained 1.1.4.2: Proportion of cases disposed through alternative dispute resolutions 1.1.4.3: No. of targeted democracy institutions with functional e-governance systems to promote efficiency and accountability a) No of courts connected to the Court Case Administration System (CCAS) b) Human Rights Information System (HURIS) 1.1.4.4: Number of country diagnostics conducted tha

comment.narrative:
Output 1: By 2017-18 Law Reform Commission, MoJCA), Judiciary, Parliament, JLOS and UHRC with Enhanced technical capacities to strengthen policies and legal frameworks for: (a) effective Separation of powers and assurance of smooth Electoral processes; and (b) HR promotion, respect and fulfillment, including equitable Access to justice. 1.1.1.1: 0% Percentage of Bills completed - (2015) Hansard 1.1.1.2: 38% of enacted laws that are implemented - (2014) JLOS performance report 1.1.1.3: 95% Proportion of completed to registered cases - (2015) JLOS performance report 1.1.1.4: Zero No. of bills that are human rights compliant enacted - (2015) Annual HR Reports 1.1.1.5: Electoral Commission Partially meets minimum core function performance benchmarks - (2013) - Election Observers’ Reports, HRC reports,Government Performance Report, Court Decisions 1.1.1.6: There is no Leadership Forum in plance and is fully functional - (2015)Parliamentary Commission Annual report, Hansard
Output 2: By 2018, JLOS and UHRC with adequate technical capacities & tools for effective human rights promotion & protection and achievement of equitable and sustained access to justice; and the Electoral Commission with strengthened Capacities & tools to implement electoral laws and ensure free and credible elections. 1.1.2.1: (a): Zero number of courts connected to the Court Case Administration System (CCAS) - (2015) JLOS Report, (b): No Human Rights Information System(HURIS) at the UHRC - (2015) Human Rights Report (c): No Electoral Complaints Management System (ECMS) at EC - (2015)Parliamentary Commission Annual Report, 1.1.2.2: 38 (2016) Number of districts in Northern and Eastern Uganda with a complete chain of frontline JLOS services (Police Station, Prosecution/legal aid, adjudication and Prison) - JLOS Reports 1.1.2.3: HRC and Electoral Commission partially meet minimum core function performance benchmarks (2013) - HR Performance Reports 1.1.2.4: 14% Proportion of HR cases disposed

Output Target 1: By 2020, Law Reform Commission, MoJCA, Judiciary, Parliament, JLOS and UHRC with Enhanced technical capacities etc. strengthen policies and legal frameworks for: (a) effective Separation of powers and assurance of smooth Electoral processes; and (b) HR promotion, respect and fulfillment, including equitable Access to justice
Targets: 1.1.1.1: 2019: 80% of Bills completed 1.1.1.2: 70% of enacted laws that are implemented 1.1.1.3: 98% of registered cases completed to registered cases
Output Target 2. By 2020, JLOS and UHRC with adequate technical Capacities & tools for effective Human Rights promotion & protection and achievement of equitable and sustained access to justice; and the Electoral Commission with Strengthened technical and technological Capacities & tools to implement Electoral laws and ensure Free and credible elections.
Targets: 1.1.2.1: 3 democracy institutions with functional e-governance systems to promote efficiency and accountability 1.1.2.2: 60 districts in Northern and Eastern Uganda with a complete chain of front-line JLOS services (Police Station, Prosecution/legal aid, adjudication and Prison) 1.1.2.3: Partial extent to which Uganda Human Right Commission and Electoral Commission effectively meet minimum core function performance benchmarks
Output Target 3 1.1.3.1: A functional inclusive and functional Civil Society’s engagement platform in place 1.1.3.2: 25 Journalists reporting on Human Rights promotion and good governance 1.1.3.3: 35 Members of Parliament equipped with knowledge and advocacy skills on accountability for gender laws and policies dis-aggregated by sex, MPs
Output Target 4 By 2020, MoJCA, MoIA, JLOS, UHRC, LGs and CSOs with Strengthened technical, technological and financial capacities to design, implement and evaluate models of HR promotion and improved Justice System Coverage & Management at decentralized level that are effective, efficient, sustainable and scalable, to inform national policies and development strategies
Targets: 1.1.4.1: 4900 LCI, II and III court officials trained 1.1.4.3: 1 democracy institution with functional e-governance systems to promote efficiency and accountability 1.1.4.4: 1 country diagnostic conducted that have informed policy options on national response to sustainable and scalable models
Output Target 5: By 2020, Targeted public institutions and CSOs have enhanced capacities to effectively include women and youth in democratic processes.
Targets: 1.1.5.2: 1 study conducted to inform gender responsiveness in the policy making process and gender equity in legislation

Output Target 1: 1.1.1.1: 80% Percentage of Bills completed. 1.1.1.2: 85% number of enacted laws that are implemented 1.1.1.3: 90% proportion of completed cases to registered cases
Output Target 2: 1.1.2.1: 3 targeted democracy institutions with functional e-governance systems to promote efficiency and accountability 1.1.2.2: 67.5% of districts in Northern and Eastern Uganda with a complete chain of front-line JLOS services (Police Station, Prosecution/legal aid, adjudication and Prison) 1.1.2.3: Greater extent to which UHRC and Electoral Commission effectively meet minimum core function performance benchmarks
Output Target 3: 1.1.3.1: 2 inclusive and functional Civil Society’s engagement platform in place (MoU with LASPNET and IJM) 1.1.3.2: 149 Journalists reporting on Human Rights promotion and good governance 1.1.3.3: 40 MPs (27Women, 12Men) equipped with knowledge and advocacy skills on accountability for gender laws and policies disaggregated by sex
Output Target 4: 1.1.4.1: 1,307 LCI, II and III court officials trained and 15 radio talk shows held in 15 districts Judicial mandate and Jurisdiction of Local Council I and II 1.1.4.3: 3 targeted democracy institutions with functional e-governance systems to promote efficiency and accountability 1.1.4.4: 3 country diagnostic conducted that have informed policy options on national response to sustainable and scalable models
Output Target 5: 1.1.5.2: 3 Study conducted to inform gender responsiveness in the policy making process and gender equity in legislation
